page.title: 07St. Brigid's Primary
page.content: Our school is called St Brigid's Primary. It was opened in 1958. There are about 200 pupils in the school. As the school was designed for a greater number of pupils we have a lot of empty classes. The spare classes are used for art work and groups of children to work with the computer. In our class we sit in groups at tables. We keep our books and jotters in a unit with pull out trays. We are divided into different groups for Maths and English. The teacher sits beside the group that she wishes to teach. We also have an extra teacher in school who works in all the classes. The primary 7 classes have visiting teachers from their future secondary school. On Wednesday afternoons primary 4-7 have activities e.g.Baking, sewing, sports. We do not need to wear uniforms.
